citations.narrative:
On February 19, 2025, Sarabi a 14 year old female Serval underwent a foreign body removal surgery to remove a piece
of a Kong toy from her intestines. As noted in the medical report, the piece of rubber was about the size of a marble (~2.5
cm long x ~1.5 cm wide) was stuck just after the sphincter that connects the stomach to the small intestines. On February
21, 2025, the patient died from a focal full-thickness intestinal rupture with secondary peritonitis and sepsis as noted on
the necropsy report.
Per the facility representative, prior to this incident Kongs were an approved enrichment device for the BZI ambassador
animal collection, while under supervision. Sarabi had been given access to a Kong, unsupervised. Immediately after the
incident occurred, Kong products and any other similar rubber devices had been removed from the approved enrichment
list for the BZI ambassador animals. Each staff having access to these animals have been retrained on approved and not
approved enrichment items.
Failure to supervise animals with enrichment items that can become intestinal foreign bodies is not handling the animals
as expeditiously and carefully as possible and can cause illness and even death. Handling of all animals shall be done in
a manner that does not cause trauma, overheating, excessive cooling, behavioral stress, physical harm, or unnecessary
discomfort. Corrected prior to inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
